general quarrel, later about husband falsely reporting him for cutting wood, then about renting room to their son
complained about not getting enough food while reaping
testimony.threat_quote: she would have her in whatever way

testimony.quarrel_subject: legal proceedings against her son for debt, husband threatened to kill him
testimony.threat_quote: husband said he wanted to kill him for 7 years

timeline.subject: Laurence femme Nicolas Viney
timeline.details: Didier fils Didier Viney questioned before Jean de Guerre about sabbat accusations; 16 witnesses deposed

timeline.details: Initial interrogation; denied charges, confronted with grandson Didier

timeline.subject: Laurence femme Nicolas Viney
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; no reproaches; confronted again with Didier

timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves thumbscrews only, in view of her age

timeline.subject: Laurence femme Nicolas Viney
timeline.details: Tortured with thumbscrews on hands and feet, then lightly racked; confessed

timeline.subject: Laurence femme Nicolas Viney
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves, subject to further repetition without torture

torture.restrictions: thumbscrews only, in view of her age

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Nicolas Viney
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'est pas a la science dudit Colin ny d'aultres de monstrer et prouver qu'elle soit sorciere
notable_quotes.english: it is not within Colin's knowledge or anyone else's to show and prove that she is a witch
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation, defending herself against accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier fils Didier Viney
notable_quotes.french: le print par les deux bras, estant lors au milieu de la cuisine et le jecta sur ses espaules et dict hault de par le diable
notable_quotes.english: grabbed him by both arms, being then in the middle of the kitchen and threw him on her shoulders and said loudly by the devil
notable_quotes.context: Describing being taken to sabbat by grandmother

notable_quotes.speaker: Mre Navel
notable_quotes.french: qu'il failloit faire perdre les bledz des riches et garder ceulx des pauvres
notable_quotes.english: it was necessary to make the crops of the rich fail and preserve those of the poor
notable_quotes.context: Devil's instructions at sabbat according to Didier

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Nicolas Viney
notable_quotes.french: Jean ou Marguitte, qui es gredee ou feine, dieu du ciel tu vueille reslargir, la Vierge Marie tu vueille pardonner de peche, ainsy bonnement qu'il est vray, que notre Seigneur a esté tiré a l'arbre de la Croix, par le jour de grand Vendredy, Au nom du pere, et du fils, et du benoist St Esprit
notable_quotes.english: Jean or Marguitte, who is afflicted or weak, God of heaven you will enlarge, the Virgin Mary you will pardon from sin, as truly as it is true, that our Lord was drawn to the tree of the Cross, on the day of Good Friday, In the name of the Father, and the Son, and the blessed Holy Spirit
notable_quotes.context: Healing prayer (Delcambre 28) taught by her father for curing those affected by evil eye

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Jean le Clerc
notable_quotes.french: qu'est cé qu'elle faisoit la ainsy pensif et qu'elle pensoit peut estre estre sur Cambas faire de la gresle
notable_quotes.english: what was she doing there so thoughtful and that perhaps she was thinking of being on Cambas making hail
notable_quotes.context: Wife of Jean le Clerc scolding Laurence during haymaking

relationships.evidence_text: she had been servant to Jean le Clerc
rented their son a room in his house
taken proceedings against her son for debt

economic_context.details: Laurence worked as agricultural laborer (reaping, haymaking) and was turned away from work for helping plague victims. Legal proceedings for debt against her son led to violence from husband. Multiple quarrels over work disputes and refusal of milk/food. She was called to heal animals for payment. Her economic vulnerability evident in need for work and her statement about having 'great need' of crops. Witness mentioned loss of animals worth 100 ecus total.

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, had to be helped back home, became worse, thought she would die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused of thinking of making hail on Cambas mountain
harms_catalog.method_alleged: threat, later cured with touch and murmuring

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: turned away from reaping because she had been with plague victims

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill and died 5 days later
harms_catalog.method_alleged: came into house and 'festoyed' the child

angry because he rented their son a room

harms_catalog.harm_description: fainted in field for an hour, remained ill for 12 months total

legal proceedings against son for debt

sick heifer died immediately after she diagnosed it
harms_catalog.method_alleged: said it would die because evil person had evil thought about it

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to give milk, saying husband complained of no profit

prior_legal_disputes.description: Claudon le Clerc took proceedings against her son for debt
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: husband Nicolas Viney imprisoned at St Dié for threatening to kill witness

prior_legal_disputes.description: husband falsely reported Colin Humbert Guidot to chapter for cutting wood

legal_context.redress_outcome: she and husband tried to have Claudon le Clerc arrested but failed

change_de_nancy.modification_details: approved thumbscrews only, in view of her age (instead of full question ordinaire et extraordinaire); later approved death sentence subject to further repetition without torture

emotional_state_notes: sitting with head bowed during confrontation with grandson

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with extensive witness testimony, detailed confession under torture, and appellate court involvement. Notable for grandson's detailed testimony about sabbat attendance and accused's known healing practice. Economic tensions evident throughout (debt, work disputes, livestock losses). Accused initially resistant, confessed under torture after thumbscrews and light racking.
